tagDescription: Petition of James Richardson for 700 acres of land in Hope township

Acknowledges appointment as commissioner to administer oath of allegiance
Petition of Thomas Eastman for a grant of land in Trafalgar Township.
Transmits copy of a despatch from Bathurst relative to a further reduction of the military force in Canada.
Respecting his return to England
Same to the same. Respecting money from the military chest for the surveyors on the Rideau river.
Enclosed: (2) Memo. of the Rideau settlement, York, 5 May 1817
Relative to the administration of U.C. in Gore's absence.
Acknowledges copies of Earl Bathurst's despatches of the 6 and 11 February, directing legal measures against Lord Selkirk and Captain Mathey.
Requesting that the attorney general may be ordered to defend him in actions brought against him by Penfield and Horner
Respecting robbery of the commissariat store at Fort Henry.
Concerning the establishment of a parade ground for troops at Fort Frederick and Point Henry.
tagPerson: Addison, T. F., Lt.-Col. military secretary

tagDescription: Enclosed: (2) Discharge from Lt.-Col. J. Warren, Bertie, 17 June 1817,
Petition of Joshua Young Cozens for permission to administer the oath of allegiance.
Stating he sails from New York instead of Quebec.
Nominating him an honorary member of the commission proceeding to Lower Canada, on the subject of duties.

Transmits his petition for an additional grant of land.
Has completed and sent to the surveyor general's office a complete map of the province.

Report on the state of the barracks at Fort Frederick
Circular letter to various public officers asking for an account of their offices
Report on sundry lots in Murray township.
Transmits a letter from Thomas G. Ridout describing the route from Oswego to Albany, with a rough map of the journey.
Petition of John Burn to locate 400 acres of land in Darlington township.
Orders staying of a prosecution against the widow of the late Barrackmaster Bradish, for a deficiency in the stores

Relative to the prorogation of parliament.
Same to the same. Respecting the suit against Capt. Vavasour
Petition of Benjamin Bowbeer of Toronto, for land on Dundas Street.
Enclosed: John McGill, York, 8 March 1817, to Gore. States there are many fees due on locations in Col. Talbot's settlement
Petition of Mary Terwilliger for land in Darlington township

Petition of David Musselman of Whitchurch for a commission to enquire into the mental state of his father Peter Musselman.

Part of the veterans of the 104th Regiment have chosen the Rideau for settlement.

Certificate that George Garside has taken the oath of allegiance.

Instructing him to forward the amount of £82.6. 10 1/4 to be applied to liquidate the expense of the Militia Claims Board

Relative to military lands near the garrison of York

May 28. Is unable to grant land to officers on active service.
